The loop has 10 curves: 1. line\\_1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.0481, 0.0] 2. line\\_2: Start Point [0.0481, 0.0], End Point [0.0481, 0.4807] 3. line\\_3: Start Point [0.0481, 0.4807], End Point [0.1775, 0.5461] 4. arc\\_1: Start Point [0.1775, 0.5461], Mid Point [0.2965, 0.7059], End Point [0.4154, 0.5461] 5. line\\_4: Start Point [0.4154, 0.5461], End Point [0.5448, 0.4807] 6. line\\_5: Start Point [0.5448, 0.4807], End Point [0.5448, 0.0] 7. line\\_6: Start Point [0.5448, 0.0], End Point [0.5929, 0.0] 8. line\\_7: Start Point [0.5929, 0.0], End Point [0.5929, 0.5016] 9. line\\_8: Start Point [0.5929, 0.5016], End Point [0.4222, 0.6936] 10. arc\\_2: Start Point [0.4222, 0.6936], Mid Point [0.2965, 0.75], End Point [0.1707, 0.6936] Constrain the Sketch Make sure to constrain the loop to be closed. The loop should have the following order of curves: line\\_1, line\\_2, line\\_3, arc\\_1, line\\_4, line\\_5, line\\_6, line\\_7, line\\_8, arc\\_2, line\\_1. Scale the Sketch Apply sketch scaling with a scaling factor of 0.75. Transform the Sketch Transform the 2D sketch into a 3D sketch by applying the euler angles and translation vector from the coordinate system. Extrude the Sketch Extrude the sketch in the positive normal direction by 0.3846 units and in the opposite direction by 0.0 units. The sketch scale is 0.75 and the operation is to create a new solid body. Shape Information The final shape is a 3D model of a rectangular prism with a curved top and a flat bottom. The top and bottom edges are rounded and the sides are straight. The model is centered and has a uniform gray color. The length is 0.75, the width is 0.75, and the height is 0.3846. Continue these instructions for the remaining parts in the CAD assembly JSON, following the structure provided here. Make sure to include all the necessary steps, curves, loops, and shape information for the junior CAD designer.</description>
